intro: Imperatoria angelica, commonly known as angel's trumpets, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its large, showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that can be white, yellow, or orange in color. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It has opposite, simple, and usually hairy leaves. The flowers are typically borne in clusters and are pollinated by insects and birds.
